title: Medial Tibial Stress Syndrome Management
content: Medial tibial stress syndrome (shin splints) presents as exercise-induced pain along the posteromedial tibial border. Treatment includes activity modification, ice therapy, and gentle stretching of the posterior compartment muscles. Biomechanical assessment may identify contributing factors such as overpronation requiring orthotic intervention. Gradual return to activity follows pain resolution, with emphasis on proper footwear and training techniques.
